MODULE.name: NativeToolbar
MODULE.HELP_OVERVIEW: The NativeToolbar methods let you create and remove toolbar at runtime.

METHOD.name: create
METHOD.DESC: Removes the current toolbar and replaces it with this one.

PARAM.name: toolbarElement
PARAM.DESC: Properties of Toolbar elements. Either :icon or :label must be specified: if both are omitted, button will not be aded to the toolbar. If both are specified, :icon is drawn and :label is discarded.

PARAM.name: label
PARAM.DESC: Visible label to display instead of an icon.

PARAM.name: action
PARAM.DESC: URL to call when button is pressed.It may be path to Ruby controller action; i.e. ‘/app/Account’ would load the Account index action. Or javascript method to call: 'javascript: methodOnTab();'.

PARAM.name: icon
PARAM.DESC: Relative path to toolbar item icon in your rhodes app (typically located in /public/images/). iPhone and Android: Icons must be no more than 30x30 pixels and must be in .png format. Windows Mobile: Icons can be any size, but all icons should have same size (default – 48x48).

PARAM.name: coloredIcon
PARAM.DESC: Use colored icon in toolbar on iPhone instead of standard monochrome white icon (prepared from image alpha).

PARAM.name: width
PARAM.DESC: Button width in pixel. Used to define separator width.

METHOD.name: remove
METHOD.DESC: Removes the current toolbar. Does nothing if there is no active toolbar.
